body_html: @karmel probably more than that, one example I can think of is the optimizers compiled by Keras is not compatible with eager -- Currently keras is utilizing its own optimizer instead TF 'native' optimizers, that will likely cause a problem in the conversion. On the other hand, the metrics compiled by Keras (and losses) might not support eager as well as of today.

body: @karmel  probably more than that, one example I can think of is the optimizers compiled by Keras is not compatible with eager -- Currently keras is utilizing its own optimizer instead TF 'native' optimizers, that will likely cause a problem in the conversion. On the other hand, the metrics compiled by Keras (and losses) might not support eager as well as of today.
